unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply knowledge and skills to plan a comprehensive assessment and treatment plan for a person at risk of or living with lymphoedema and chronic oedemas using latest evidence (Clinical Practitioner)
Discuss individual and societal impact of lymphoedema and chronic oedema models of care and how latest imaging assessments can change clinical practice (Engaged Global Citizen)
Explain the revised anatomy and physiology of the lymphatic system and teachings from ICG lymphography (Scientist and Scholar)
Define the prospective surveillance and early intervention model of care in cancer rehabilitation and how this can be integrated into healthcare settings (Scientist and Scholar)

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: This micro unit will be presented as a series of well designed learning activities with embedded readings and knowledge checks.

enrolment_rules.description: AQF level 7 in a health degree or recognised equivalent with national registration if required.

assessments.description: Multiple choice questions and short answer

data.unit_offering_text:
*

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.subject_search_title: LYMP8002 - Contemporary Evidence in Lymphoedema Management

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This is the second of two foundation units underpinning lymphoedema management and  focuses on the contemporary evidence.  In this unit, you will review the latest research underpinning comprehensive assessment and treatment of lymphoedema.  You will develop an understanding of the importance of a prospective surveillance model of care and early intervention to prevent and/or manage lymphoedema.  Advances in assessment including use of bioimpedance spectroscopy and indocyanine green (ICG) lymphography will be explored and how this information is used to enhance intervention.  You will also have the opportunity to analyse the organisation and structure of a service providing comprehensive care and integrating education and research. This unit will contribute to your development of the Scientist and Scholar, Clinical Practitioner and Engaged Global Citizen graduate capabilities.
data.search_title: LYMP8002 - Contemporary Evidence in Lymphoedema Management
